basics.name: Nick Herrig
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary: This is where the summary goes!

work.name: Nebullam
work.description: Nebullam Inc., a Y-Combinator and venture-backed startup, is revolutionizing agriculture with its direct-to-consumer indoor farming approach. They stand out with their unique offering of produce subscriptions and the world's freshest salads through a convenient drive-thru.
work.summary: As the Lead Software Engineer at Nebullam, I am responsible for the development and maintenance of the company's software and hardware systems. I work closely with the CEO and CTO to develop and implement the company's technical vision.
highlights: Spearheaded a Computer Vision project, leading the deployment of a Yolov8 model on a Nvidia Jetson using Roboflow. This initiative significantly enhanced the collection of vehicle images at the drive-thru, providing valuable insights into our customers

Successfully deployed a Slack bot agent with LangChain, integrating OpenAI APIs and Serper APIs hosted on Replit. This initiative was aimed at familiarizing the team with interacting with Large Language Models (LLMs) in a casual, watercooler-style setting, thereby enhancing team engagement and tech adaptability.

Led the successful launch of a Shopify store offering subscription-based produce bundles, resulting in over $250,000 in net revenue in its first year. This project not only expanded market reach but also established an e-commerce platform for direct-to-consumer sales.

Led the swift 6-week design and implementation of a tech stack for our pivot to drive-thru restaurants, projected to earn $650,000 in first-year revenue. This included IoT farm equipment, a comprehensive POS system, and integrated digital infrastructure.

volunteer.summary: As a mentor and judge at Kreative Horizon Hackathons, I provided guidance to participants in developing their technical skills and played a role in selecting and rewarding the most innovative and effective solutions.

volunteer.organization: Iowa State University Pappajohn Center for Entrepreneurship
volunteer.summary: At Iowa State University's Pitch Competitions, I combine my roles as a mentor and judge, offering valuable insights to participants to refine their pitches and playing a pivotal part in selecting the most promising and innovative technology projects.

projects.name: Home Lab
projects.description: Various stuff hosted on my home servers.
highlights: Built by all women team of newbie programmers
Using modern technologies such as GoogleMaps, Chrome Extension and Javascript
